intro: Pearcea strigosa, commonly known as the rough pearcea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Pearcea strigosa is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
